programme.title: Live European Tour Golf
programme.desc: The PGA Championship. Coverage of the second day of one of the tour's most prestigious events, held at Wentworth in Surrey, where Chris Wood was victorious last year. The Englishman was playing fairly steadily at this stage of the 2016 tournament, having shot a second-round 70 to go with his 72 on day one. However, a 68 and 69 on the final two days catapulted him to the title and approximately £700,000 in prize money.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Man Utd v Newcastle 1999.
programme.desc: We revisit the 1999 FA Cup final between Manchester United and Newcastle. The Reds entered the match as Premier League champions having clinched the title the previous weekend.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Chelsea v Aston Villa 2000.
programme.desc: We revisit the 2000 FA Cup final between Aston Villa and Chelsea, the last final to be played at the old Wembley Stadium. This was Aston Villa's first final appearance since 1957.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2001 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Liverpool at the Millennium Stadium, the first final in which the managers of both teams were from outside the British Isles.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Chelsea. Freddie Ljungberg was aiming to become the first man to score in successive Cup finals since Bobby Smith for Spurs.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Southampton at the Millennium Stadium. The final was the first to be played indoors; the roof was closed due to bad weather.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Man Utd v Millwall 2004.
programme.desc: We revisit the 2004 FA Cup final between Manchester United and Millwall. The Lions became only the second team from outside the top flight to reach the final since 1982.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Arsenal v Man Utd 2005.
programme.desc: We revisit the 2005 FA Cup final between Arsenal and Manchester United. This was the first final to have been decided via penalty shootout.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Liverpool v West Ham 2006.
programme.desc: We revisit the 2006 FA Cup final between Liverpool and West Ham. This six-goal thriller is widely regarded as one of the greatest finals in the history of the competition.(n)

programme.title: FA Cup Final Classics
programme.sub-title: FA Cup: Chelsea v Man Utd 2007.
programme.desc: We revisit the 2007 FA Cup final between Chelsea and Manchester United. This was the first competitive game to be held at the new Wembley.(n)

programme.title: The Emirates FA Cup Preview
programme.desc: A look ahead to the Emirates FA Cup final at Wembley between London rivals Arsenal and Chelsea.(n)

programme.desc: The best match-up of the week from the USA.(n)

programme.desc: The semi-finals of the Internationaux de Strasbourg, part of the WTA tour. Previous winners here have included Lindsay Davenport and Steffi Graf.(n)

programme.title: Carpi - Frosinone 26/05
programme.desc: Cod. 404963. Serie B. Play Off. Semifinale d'andata. Collegamento ore 20:00 con Prepartita. Il Carpi ha vinto lunedì il preliminare contro il Cittadella e sfida ora il Frosinone. programme.title: Bologna - Juventus 27/05
programme.desc: Cod. 405258. Serie A. 38a giornata. Collegamento ore 17:30 con Prepartita. Emiliani per salutare il Dall'Ara con la 9^ vittoria in casa in un campionato, non ci riescono da 15 anni. Un solo successo (3-0 nel 1998) nelle ultime 26 sfide a Bologna con la Juve, 10 pari e 15 ko. I neo-campioni bianconeri (6^ scudetto consecutivo) per onorare il campo, ma forse già con la testa a Cardiff e al "triplete". Commento: Di Marzio-Marocchi(n)

programme.title: L'uomo della Domenica: Allegri
programme.desc: Giorgio Porra' racconta Massimiliano Allegri, da Livorno a Cardiff il viaggio di un allenatore che continua il suo ciclo vincente nella Juventus. Le origini, i trascorsi da fantasista, l'influenza dei maestri, le conquiste stagionali, l'imminente duello con Zidane. Con Alessandro Del Piero, Massimo Ambrosini ed Alessandra Bocci. Ed i consueti richiami letterari e cinematografici(n)

Perché se il Perugia può speculare sulla migliore posizione in classifica, il Benevento deve necessariamente provare a ribaltare le gerarchie. Telecronaca Massara-Minotti(n)
